citation.article-title: Sphingomonas aquatilis sp. nov., Sphingomonas koreensis sp. nov., and Sphingomonas taejonensis sp. nov., yellow-pigmented bacteria isolated from natural mineral water.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Sphingomonas taejonensis sp. nov.
Sphingomonas taejonensis (tae.jon.en'sis. N.L. f. adj. taejonensis of Taejon, Korea, the geographical origin of the new species)
Cells are Gram-negative, motile rods with single polar flagella.
Colonies are circular, entire, low-convex, smooth, opaque and pale yellow.
Indole, urease and arginine dihydrolase are not produced.
Catalase, oxidase and β-galactosidase are positive.
Gelatin is not liquified and glucose is not fermented.
Reduction of nitrate and hydrolysis of aesculin are negative.

Caprate, glucose and malate are assimilated; 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, adipate, citrate, D-melibiose, D-ribose, D-sorbitol, D-sucrose, gluconate, glycogen, L-arabinose, maltose, mannose, N-acetylglucosamine, phenylacetate, rhamnose and salicin are not assimilated.
Acid is weakly produced oxidatively from glucose, but not from rhamnose and glycerol.
The G+­C content of the DNA is 63 mol%.
The major isoprenoid quinone is ubiquinone Q-10.
The major non-polar fatty acids are 18:1ω7c, 16: 0, 16:1ω7t and 17:1ω6c; the major 2-hydroxy fatty acids are 14:0 2-OH, 15:0 2-OH and 16:0 2-OH.
The type strain, JSS54T (=KCTC 2884T=KCCM 41068T), was isolated from natural mineral water from Taejon City, Korea.
